experience.description:
I was an SDE 1 intern for the Amazon Associates team. I developed and owned an end-to-end recommendation system for matching brands with content creators. To accomplish this I created an ML recommender model and deployed it using AWS and Amazon's internal tools and services. I built a pipeline to automate data preprocessing and model training, evaluation, and prediction. I also authored a design document that detailed my research findings, proposed architecture, results, and next steps.
Throughout this internship, I learned how to work with multiple AWS Services such as Sagemaker, S3, EMR, ECR, CloudFormation, and IAM. I also took multiple courses through Amazon's Machine Learning University to expand my ML skills.

I was a Software Engineering Intern at the Tech Incubator Lab.
During Spring 2021, I worked with the DataProfiler team to add new features and tests to the open-source DataProfiler repository.
In the fall, I worked with the Accessibility team to migrate Capital One's digital property inventory to a web interface. We created a ReactJS Web App that was hosted on AWS using S3, Lambda, add DynamoDB.
Over the summer, I worked with the CyberML team to develop anomaly detection models for network traffic using Machine Learning. We created models from the ground up - starting with an initial research stage and ending with developed proof of concept models that are being carried forward by the CyberML team. These models will help Capital One identify new and existing threats on their network perimeter.
I have also gained experience working with Agile Methodology and had the opportunity to use Capital One's Tech Invest In Yourself Days to gain skills in AWS and Unsupervised Learning.

experience.company: University of Maryland at College Park
experience.description:
I am currently a peer mentor for the First-Year Innovation & Research Experience program. I am also a STIC Facilitator for CMSC389T (formerly CMSC388T).
During Winter 2021, I was a CS Undergradute Teaching Assistant for Introduction to Git, Github, and Project Management Tools (CMSC388T). I helped design the lectures, create the projects, and launch the new CMSC course. I also managed four teams in a basic DevOps environment.
During Fall 2020, I was a CS Undergraduate Teaching Assistant for CMSC330 (Organization of Programming Languages). I held weekly office hours and helped students learn and understand the course material.

experience.company: University of Maryland at College Park
experience.description:
I am currently pursing research on using Generative Adversarial Networks to improve building damage classification following natural disasters.
I have pursued research focused on investigating various Generative Adversarial Networks, their applications, and extrapolating them to new datasets and problems. As a part of this research, I wrote journal reports on the observations and analysis of experiments. I co-authored and submitted a paper on my research to IJCV where it is currently under review.

experience.company: University of Maryland at College Park
experience.description: I worked as a Student Software Developer for the Division of Information Technology at the University of Maryland. I worked on projects with Service-Now and automated user testing using Selenium WebDriver and performance testing using Locust.

My primary objective was to work on the Smmindy project. Smmindy or the Sales Marketing Mind, is a project that involves scraping details of jobs (opportunities), people (leads), and companies (accounts) from various websites such as LinkedIn, RemoteOk, Github, etc, classifying this data to identify potential clients using Machine Learning, connecting all this data together, and displaying this data on a website. I worked with Python, NodeJS, ReactJS, Docker, Cassandra, Kubernetes, ElasticSearch, and Digital Ocean on this project.
Secondary responsibilities included creating Headless Chrome Browser NodeJS bots for automating tasks and writing blogs for the Anant Corporation Blog.

experience.position: Community Lead, API Team Lead, Alexa Skills and Web Developer
experience.description:
API Team Lead - Reviewed and Tested the company's API and created a website to provide documentation for the API. This website was later used at the Big Parser Summer Hackathon.
Developer for Voice Product - Coded an Alexa application that connects the Big Parser Grid to Alexa using Natural Language Processing, NodeJS, Python, and AWS Lambda. Met with other developers and company heads to talk to them about the Big Parser Voice product.
Community Lead - Met with High School and Middle School students and taught them how to code, use the Big Parser API, and create Grids and Alexa Skills to prepare them for the Big Parser Summer Hackathon. Mentored at the 14-hour Big Parser Hackathon held at Microsoft, and taught students how to code and helped them develop full-fledged projects using the Big Parser API.

I was a coach for a math team participating in the Loudoun County Regional Math Tournament, and it was my job to ensure that the students on my team are well prepared for their upcoming competition. As a coach, I taught various mathematical concepts in Algebra 1 and Geometry to a group of 8th graders. I taught students how to address problems that can arise during a competition and instill collaborative techniques and skills into the students, not only to aid them in this specific competition but also to help them with their daily academic careers.

I tutored young children in Hindi and taught them how to speak common phrases and sentences in the language. I also taught kids about Indian culture, as well as teaching a basic version of Indian History and Geography.

education.description: For my senior research project at TJHSST, I created a system that uses Computer Vision and Interactive Machine Learning to take attendance of a traditional school classroom.

extracurriculars.company: University of Maryland at College Park
extracurriculars.position: Webmaster, Content Creator for Rising Researchers
extracurriculars.description: I am a member of the Rising Researchers Club at UMD. I work with members of this club to create material to educate high school students on how they can read and understand research papers and get involved with academic research.

extracurriculars.company: University of Maryland at College Park
extracurriculars.position: Vision Sub-Team, Maryland Unmanned Aerial Systems
extracurriculars.description: I was a member of the Maryland Unmanned Aerial Systems Club at UMD. Through this club we engineer and program a drone to compete at the Association For Unmanned Systems International's Student Unmanned Aerial Systems Competition. I worked with the Vision Subteam to enable the drone to process and classify ground targets.

accomplishments.description: I competed with a team of students on behalf of the Senior Computer Team at the High School Programming Competition at the University of Virginia. My team and I placed third at the competition for two years in a row.
